= Software =

== General libraries and tools ==
 * [http://junit.org/ JUnit]
 * [http://testng.org/doc/index.html TestNG]
 * [http://fest.easytesting.org/wiki/pmwiki.php Fixtures for Easy Software Testing (FEST)]: library of tools to ease testing
 * [http://unitils.sourceforge.net/ Unitils]: java libraries offering general testing methods
 * [Mycila Testing Framework]: integration of JMock, Guice, Spring and others
 * [http://www.opensourcetesting.org/ Open Source Software Testing Tools]  sorted by purpose and programming language and provided with short description


== Mock frameworks ==
 * [https://jmockit.dev.java.net/ JMockit Testing Toolkit]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/powermock/ PowerMock]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/mockito/ Mockito]
 * [http://www.jmock.org/ JMock]
 * [http://www.easymock.org/ EasyMock]
 * [https://jeasytest.dev.java.net/ JEasyTest]: framework for testing applications that cannot be tested with the means of standard mocking frameworks


== Eclipse plug-ins ==
 * [http://moreunit.sourceforge.net/ MoreUnit]: marks class for that currently no JUnit tests exist
 * [http://improvingworks.com/products/infinitest/ Infinitest]: triggers test execution when code base has changed
 * [http://www.eclemma.org/ EclEmma]: visualize Code coverage
 * [djUnit]: JUnit TestRunner with the custom classloader. It modifies class in loading to JVM, and runs tests using the modified class. Testing using Virtual Mock Objects is possible so.
 * [http://lattu.sourceforge.net/ Lattu]: Framework for testing Eclipse RCP Applications


== OSGi ==
 * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/osgiunit/ OSGiUnit]: JUnit tests for OSGi applications
 * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/osgi-bdt/ OSGi BDT]: tools to support building, deploying, and testing OSGi applications
